basics.name: Mostafa Ali Mahmoud
basics.label: Systems & Biomedical Engineering Student
basics.summary: Senior undergraduate in Systems and Biomedical Engineering at Cairo University with a cGPA of 3.8/4.0 (Ranked 6th). Specialized in AI, Computer Vision, and Medical Imaging with experience in building agentic systems and clinical AI models.

work.name: IBM
work.summary: Worked on a large-scale project as part of the AI team.
highlights: Developed a multi-agent system using MCPs and AutoGen.

work.name: Nile University Research Office
work.summary: Worked on a research project regarding fundus imaging.
highlights: Focused on early detection and diagnosis of papilledema using AI.

volunteer.summary: Led five technical clubs (AI, Embedded Systems, SWE, Medical Equipment, Research).
highlights: Organized and delivered workshops and competitions for over 500 students.

awards.title: 1st Place - IEEE Egyptian Students Paper Contest
awards.summary: Represented Egypt on the global contest for the project 'Real-Time Student Drowsiness Detection'.

awards.title: 1st Place - NU Egypt Undergraduate Research Forum
awards.summary: Awarded 1st place in the field of Computer Science.

publications.name: Real-Time Student Drowsiness Detection Using CNN Spatial Transformer in Online Learning
publications.summary: Developed a real-time drowsiness detection system utilizing Spatial Transformers and CNNs, deployed as a cross-platform mobile application and website.

publications.name: Detecting Student Disengagement in Online Classes Using Deep Learning: A Review
publications.summary: A comprehensive review of deep learning techniques for detecting student disengagement.

projects.name: CUBE.AI
projects.summary: Agentic Platform For Clinical AI Model Development.
highlights: Built a self-configuring nnU-Net platform for radiologists.
Integrated SAM, Vista3D, and nnInteractive for PACS-to-deployment workflow.
Currently advancing the system into an agentic AI radiologist assistant.

projects.name: Trans Quake
projects.summary: Real-Time Seismic Event Detection on Moon and Mars (NASA Apollo).
highlights: Developed a Transformer-based architecture for extraterrestrial seismic events.
Achieved 0.88 accuracy using STA/LTA and spectral extraction.

projects.name: Cognitive Control Analysis
projects.summary: Neural Correlates of Cognitive Control (Flanker Task fMRI Analysis).
highlights: Performed group-level fMRI analysis using FSL.
Identified significant activation in the anterior cingulate and dorsolateral prefrontal cortex.

projects.name: Spectrum Code
highlights: Developed a portfolio of 7 software applications/simulators.
specialized in audio recognition, 2D beamforming, and biomedical signal analysis.
